headline: Idaho takes on Sacramento State after Smith’s 22-point performance
author: The Associated Press
sentences:
Idaho Vandals (8-18, 5-11 Big Sky) at Sacramento State Hornets (7-16, 3-13 Big Sky)
Sacramento, California; Thursday, 10 p.m. EST
BOTTOM LINE: Idaho visits the Sacramento State Hornets after Rashad Smith scored 22 points in Idaho’s 83-80 victory over the Eastern Washington Eagles.

If you do not yet have a Torstar account, you can create one now (it is free)
Conversations are opinions of our readers and are subject to the Code of Conduct.
LAST 10 GAMES: Hornets: 2-8, averaging 63.1 points, 26.2 rebounds, 11.3 assists, 5.9 steals and 2.2 blocks per game while shooting 44.5% from the field.
TOP PERFORMERS: William FitzPatrick is shooting 39.5% from beyond the arc with 2.6 made 3-pointers per game for the Hornets, while averaging 9.1 points.
Vandals: 5-5, averaging 73.0 points, 29.9 rebounds, 10.7 assists, 3.9 steals and 2.3 blocks per game while shooting 47.9% from the field.

___

SHARE:
Anyone can read Conversations, but to contribute, you should be registered Torstar account holder.
Bryce Fowler is shooting 49.4% and averaging 19.2 points over the past 10 games for Sacramento State.
Idaho is sixth in the Big Sky scoring 73.8 points per game and is shooting 44.2%.
Tanner Christensen is averaging 8.7 points and 6.1 rebounds for the Vandals.
Sacramento State has a 4-9 record in games decided by at least 10 points.
Smith is averaging 1.5 made 3-pointers over the last 10 games for Idaho.
Trevante Anderson scored 17 points to help lead the Vandals to the win.
The teams play for the second time this season in Big Sky play.
Their opponents have averaged 71.9 points per game.
The Vandals won the last matchup 73-72 on Jan. 22.
The Vandals are 5-11 against conference opponents.
Their opponents have averaged 77.8 points.
The Star does not endorse these opinions.
The Hornets are 3-8 on their home court.
